title: U.S. stock futures up slightly amid growing tensions with China
text: U.S. stock index futures made slight gains late Sunday amid rising tensions between the U.S.

title: Asian shares reverse early gains, eyes on China-U.S. trade relations
text: A gauge of Asian stocks pared early gains on Monday amid souring relations between China and the United States, with Hong Kong shares extending losses on mounting fears about future stability in the city.

title: The Market’s Myopic Focus on a Vaccine
text: What happens when the market begins to fixate on something … say, progress (or setbacks) toward a cure for a global pandemic? Might that singular focus result in dangerous volatility as good (or bad) news toys with investors?

title: U.S. stock futures rise despite growing tensions with China
text: U.S. stock index futures gained late Sunday despite rising tensions between the U.S.

title: Prepare For A Bear Market
text: This article discusses evidence that a bear market is likely to persist.

title: Three Factors Driving Oil’s Dramatic Rebound
text: Oil prices have turned around dramatically in the past month. There are three primary reasons for this.

title: Mixed Sector Performance In Bear Market Rallies
text: Technical analyst Tom Aspray examines dramatic performance difference between the sectors. Continuing his series on bear markets past and present, this week Tom also examines some parallels between present sector performance and 2008.

title: If The Fed Is Worrying, Shouldn’t You Worry Too?
text: Employment data confirm that, even in mid-May, after some states had begun to reopen, the overall economy was still deteriorating and had not yet hit bottom.

title: 4 Investing Themes for the 2020s
text: The current coronavirus crisis is cementing a few secular trends into place.

title: Most publicly listed companies keep U.S. small-business aid loans
text: More than four-fifths of publicly listed companies that received emergency small-business loans from the U.S. government have held onto them, sticking with a certification that they need the money, according to data from market research firm FactSquared.

title: Trump Economic Adviser: Unemployment Could Remain In Double Digits Through November
text: Senior White House Adviser Kevin Hassett expects unemployment to rise above 20% this month.

title: Here's Why You Might Not Want to Buy Stocks Right Now
text: Maybe it's time to hit the pause button with stocks. But maybe not.

title: The Stock Market Rally: Should I Buy Now or Wait for a Pullback?
text: Markets have bounced back sharply from their March lows. Here's what to do if you missed the bottom.
